intro: Ascolepis peteri, commonly known as the Peter's spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves that are typically green with a waxy texture. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia, which are surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It is native to southern Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. Ascolepis peteri is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
